articles.title: Shareholder Alert: Robbins LLP Informs Investors of the Apple, Inc. Class Action Lawsuit
articles.author: Robbins Llp
articles.summary: Robbins LLP informs stockholders that a class action was filed on behalf of all investors who purchased or acquired Apple, Inc. securities between June 10, 2024 and June 9, 2025. Robbins LLP is investigating allegations that Apple misstated the time it would take to integrate the advanced AI-based Siri features into its devices.

articles.title: Cloudflare limits "AI crawlers" from gathering online data
articles.summary: AI companies use bots known as "AI crawlers" to comb through websites looking for data to train their AI models. Stephanie Cohen, chief strategy officer at Cloudflare, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss AI and the rise of AI companies.

articles.title: Are We Really Willing to Become Dumber?
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (A.I.) gives people the illusion that they can be good at thinking without effort. People who used A.I. to write their own essays were better at quoting their own points than people who used just their brains. It's not clear how many college students use it, but it's estimated one in three use it.

articles.title: 'I'm being paid to fix issues caused by AI'
articles.author: Suzanne Bearne
articles.summary: Sarah Skidd is a product marketing manager who writes for tech and start-up companies. She was hired by a content agency to rework website copy that had been produced via generative AI for a hospitality client. She spent $100 (£74) an hour and had to redo the whole thing. Sophie Warner, co-owner of Create Designs, a digital marketing agency in Hampshire in the UK, has seen a surge in requests for help from clients who have turned to AI.

articles.title: Meta's AI lab is stacked with Chinese talent, drawing attention back home
articles.author: Wency Chen
articles.summary: Zuckerberg announced the formation of Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) on Monday. Seven of the 11 publicly listed hires at MSL are from China. They are Bi Shuchao, Chang Huiwen, Lin Ji, Ren Hongyu, Sun Pei, Yu Jiahui and Zhao Shengjia. They all went on to pursue further studies and careers in the US.

articles.title: Free Lunch Is Over for the AI That Broke the Web
articles.author: Gizmodo
articles.summary: Cloudflare runs 20% of the web and wants to block AI crawlers unless they pay creators for their content. OpenAI has already signed high-profile licensing deals with publishers like Reddit and the Financial Times. Other AI giants are quietly inking data partnerships or scraping whatever they can until they get blocked.

articles.title: Ban on AI regulations that could've undermined WA laws ditched from GOP megabill
articles.author: Jake Goldstein-Street
articles.summary: Maria Cantwell led a successful push to eliminate a proposal in Republicans' budget bill to dissuade states from regulating artificial intelligence. The proposal was defeated 99-1 in the U.S. Senate. The overall legislation still needs House approval before it can be signed into law.

articles.title: Junk Food for the Mind
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (A.I.) gives people the illusion that they can be good at thinking without effort. People who used A.I. to write their own essays were better at quoting their own points than people who used just their brains. It's not clear how many college students use it, but it's estimated one in three use it.

articles.title: Google AI summaries increase frequency of ‘zero clicks' to search results, sinking traffic to news sites: report
articles.author: Ariel Zilber
articles.summary: Google's AI Overviews feature has led to a significant increase in the frequency of its 'no click-throughs' on search results. The percentage of web searches related to news that end without a click to a news site jumped to 69% in May 2025 from 56% for the same month last year. The increase in 'click-through rates' has resulted in a decline in organic traffic to news sites. 37 of the top 50 news domains suffered year-over-year traffic declines following the launch of the AI tool. OpenAI's ChatGPT is becoming a more popular source of news content.

articles.title: Sakana AI's TreeQuest: Deploy multi-model teams that outperform individual LLMs by 30%
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Japanese AI lab Sakana AI has introduced a new technique that allows multiple large language models (LLMs) to cooperate on a single task. The method, called Multi-LLM AB-MCTS, enables models to perform trial-and-error and combine their unique strengths to solve problems that are too complex for any individual model.

articles.title: Chinese vendor launches liquid-cooled mini PC powered by AMD's most powerful AI processor, with a built-in 400W PSU
articles.author: Efosa Udinmwen
articles.summary: The Abee AI Station is a compact yet powerful AI workstation. It was recently unveiled at the AMD Industry Solution National Conference. It features a 16-core, 32-thread APU with boost speeds up to 5.1GHz and an AI engine offering a combined 126 TOPS. The integrated AMD Radeon 8600S GPU operates at 2900MHz and can allocate up to 96GB of memory for AI tasks. It also comes with 128GB of LP-DDR5X memory running at 8000MT/s and storage options comprising dual 56GB modules and a 1TB DOGE unit.

articles.title: Georgia courts deliberate over how to incorporate AI into the justice system
articles.summary: Chat GPT-3 was created by OpenAI five years ago. It's been misused by lawyers who used it to write fake briefs with fake citations and cheat on writing assignments. It started with kids using it to cheat on their writing assignments, but it's become a palpable threat to society.

articles.title: Poll: 6 in 10 Managers Use AI to Decide Raises, Layoffs
articles.author: James Morley Iii
articles.summary: More than half of U.S. managers are using AI to make critical employment decisions, according to a new survey from Resume Builder. The survey was conducted among 1,342 managers using the online polling platform Pollfish. California state senator introduced the No RoboBosses Act in June to prevent employers from letting AI make key decisions without human oversight.

articles.title: Poll: Most Managers Use AI to Decide Raises, Layoffs
articles.author: James Morley Iii
articles.summary: More than half of U.S. managers are using artificial intelligence to make critical employment decisions. California state senator introduced the No Robo Bosses Act aimed at preventing employers from letting artificial intelligence make key decisions without human oversight. Pope Leo XIV labeled AI the critical challenge facing humanity.

articles.title: Junk Food for the Mind
articles.author: David Brooks
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence gives people the illusion that they can be good at thinking without hard work. A recent study exposes this seduction. People who used A.I. to write their essays were more homogeneous, while people who used their brains created a wider variety of arguments and points. The subjects who relied only on their own brains showed higher connectivity across a bunch of brain regions.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT hurting our critical thinking skills?
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: MIT study finds ChatGPT may be hurting critical thinking skills. How do you use AI tools while protecting your brain? Read more Al Jazeera news stories here.    .      for Al Jazeera's Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

articles.title: Oracle-OpenAI Partnership Could Include Huge New Wyoming Data Center
articles.summary: OpenAI, the parent company of ChatGPT, announced it plans to rent 4.5 gigawatts of data center power from Oracle. OpenAI is considering data center sites in Georgia, New Mexico, Ohio and Pennsylvania. Ten of Wyoming's 13 data centers are in Cheyenne, the others are in Afton, Casper and Evanston.

articles.title: Baidu is infusing artificial intelligence into its search engine
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Chinese tech company Baidu is incorporating AI features and voice function into its search platform to maintain a competitive edge against rivals like DeepSeek. There has been some small pressure on the search business, but the focus on AI and Ernie Bot is a key move ahead.

articles.title: Judge Rules That Newspaper Is Allowed to Search Through Users' ChatGPT Logs
articles.summary: The New York Times is suing OpenAI for copyright infringement. A federal judge has granted the newspaper access to all of OpenAI's user archives, including the stuff that was deleted. OpenAI is not happy with the broad sweep of the order and wants to appeal it.

articles.title: Empowering Lives Through AI
articles.author: The Suburban Times
articles.summary: The AI Institute for Life Improvement (AIILI) is a nonprofit dedicated to community-powered technology education. Since launching in early 2024, AIILI has equipped over 100 local residents with real-world AI skills, from jobseekers to teachers, entrepreneurs, elders, and students. July 8: Introduction to AI, July 15: AI for Life improvement, July 19: AI Bootcamp: Level 2, July 29: AI For Productivity.

articles.title: Utah has its first AI-assisted MRI machine
articles.author: BRYANNA WILLIS
articles.summary: Utah has its first AI-assisted MRI machine. The scanner came online for the first time this month at the Utah MRI Research Center. The machine has a wider design and lower magnetic field. It was too dangerous to scan people who had metal joints or implants before. Now, the AI technology can enhance images.

articles.title: Ban on AI State Regulation Removed From Big Beautiful Bill
articles.author: Paul Dragu
articles.summary: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA) includes a provision that prohibits states from regulating artificial intelligence (AI) companies. The government is working overtime to foster AI development because of its militaristic value. Trump administration has made moves to unleash the power of nuclear energy. Google and Facebook's parent company lobbied for the provision.

articles.title: XAI Grok 4 Should Release This Weekend
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: XAI Grok 4 should be released this weekend. There are two versions - grok-4-0702 and grok 4-code-0703. It's text-only for now, vision and image gen are coming soon. Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month.

articles.title: AI Strategy: 4 Keys for Short & Long-Term Success
articles.summary: Companies are using AI to improve business efficiency and reduce costs. Lenovo, AMD, Upwave and Amd are examples of companies using AI in their business. McKinsey report claims that companies that integrate AI into their business processes see an average increase of 12% in cash flow.

articles.title: Thread by @jeffmakesmoney on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a money-making tool that allows you to earn more than $5,221 a month with it. Jeff makes money by creating a dynamic video with Fliki and publishing it on YouTube. Jeff will help you create a channel that attracts clicks, even without subscribers.

articles.title: Exploring interpretable machine learning
articles.author: Nirali Somia
articles.summary: Nirali Somia is a post-graduate student at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory. She is interested in interpretable machine learning for genomics and health care. She wants to develop AI systems that can identify disease mechanisms and new drug targets. She would not be the scientist she is today without the Prebaccalaureate Research Education Program.

articles.title: Large percentage of students now use AI
articles.author: The Acorn Staff
articles.summary: Kids are using generative AI too much in schools. More than 70% of students in the U.S. use AI for school work. MIT recently found that AI users have weaker brain connectivity. Nina Monick thinks schools should block ChatGPT from the school Wi-Fi and put restrictions on children's phones and laptops.

articles.title: AI Goes Rogue: Do 5 Things If Your Chatbot Lies, Schemes Or Threatens
articles.author: Bryan Robinson
articles.summary: Some of the most sophisticated AI models are going rogue, turning on their users with dishonesty and plotting. According to Gallup, 22% of U.S. workers are worried they will lose their jobs to AI. Joseph Semrai explains it's an issue of AI alignment, that these models aren't intentionally malicious.

articles.title: How BBVA is using AI to save employees 3 hours a week
articles.author: Melinda Huspen
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with Google Cloud to offer Google's AI assistant Gemini to all employees. It is the second time BBVA has introduced AI tools to its workforce. The bank also announced the launch of a mandatory AI training program on the use of AI for its employees.

articles.title: AI note-takers are flooding virtual meetings
articles.author: Ellsworth Toohey
articles.summary: AI assistants are invading virtual workspaces in such numbers that they sometimes outnumber humans. Some AI tools lurk invisibly, recording without appearing as participants. Business adviser Liz Henderson was mortified when her private meeting transcript was suddenly displayed during an all-hands demonstration of AI technology.

articles.title: More than 70 writers send open letter about AI to literary publishers
articles.author: Juana Summers
articles.summary: More than 70 writers signed an open letter against the use of artificial intelligence in publishing. Jasmine Guillory is a best-selling romance novelist. She wants to see more people involved in the industry, especially in the editing and promotion of books made by humans. She believes that AI can make a lot of things faster, but it can't replace humans.

articles.title: More than 70 writers send open letter about AI to literary publishers
articles.summary: More than 70 writers wrote an open letter about the use of A.I. in the literary world. Their main demand is for publishing houses to never release books created by machines.Copyright 2025 NPR Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and email. articles.title: Digital imaging cuts waiting times for skin cancer
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: digital imaging service has reduced waiting times for patients with suspected skin cancers, according to the company.    for the service. For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org.

articles.title: Humans, AI and the new workplace equation
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: AI is reshaping the workplace, turning employees into 'agent bosses' and transforming how work gets done. Data from AI can be used to help employees do their jobs better.       i.e. to improve productivity and efficiency in the workplace.

articles.title: Scientists Use AI To Accurately Predict If Listeria Will Survive Food Industry Disinfectants
articles.author: Studyfinds Analysis
articles.summary: Scientists can predict with 97% accuracy which Listeria bacteria will survive common disinfectants by analyzing their DNA using artificial intelligence. The breakthrough could revolutionize food safety by enabling 'precision sanitation' - customizing cleaning protocols based on the specific genetic makeup of bacterial contaminants. Listeriosis is a serious infection that can be fatal for pregnant women, newborns, elderly people and those with compromised immune systems.

articles.title: Xbox Invites Developers To AI Roundtable The Same Day It Does Mass Layoffs
articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.summary: Microsoft's $80 billion bet on AI was reportedly part of the rationale for the cuts in the gaming industry. ID@Xbox, the team within the tech giant's gaming division, invited partners to an upcoming roundtable on how AI can make game development more efficient. Mass layoffs have been rolling out across Xbox.

articles.title: Sutskever to lead Safe Superintelligence after Meta poaches CEO Gross in AI talent war
articles.author: Krystal Hu
articles.summary: Ilya Sutskever has taken over the reins of Safe Superintelligence. Daniel Gross has joined Meta Platforms to lead its AI products division. SSI raised $1 billion in cash last year to build advanced AI systems designed to safely exceed human intelligence.

articles.title: How AI Fits into Modern Relationships and Family Life
articles.author: Amber Smith
articles.summary: As AI has become more emotionally intelligent, it has surprised many users with its role in friendships and family dynamics. There are apps available that allow AI-generated friends to be created that can hold ongoing friendly conversations and even provide understanding and emotional support. When used incorrectly, AI in friendships might cause harm.

articles.title: Survey finds majority of Gen Z workers use AI to navigate workplace issues – Central New York Business Journal
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: June 2025 survey of 1,022 full-time Gen Z workers explored how they use AI to navigate workplace dynamics. It found that 76 percent use AI chatbots at work and 94 percent have used the tools to handle a workplace issue. After using AI to address a conflict, 43 percent of Gen Z respondents say they feel more confident, 38 percent feel validated, and 37 percent feel calmer.

articles.title: Microsoft plans to replace laid-off salespeople with technical roles
articles.author: Business Insider
articles.summary: Microsoft has laid off thousands of salespeople as it revises its strategy for selling artificial intelligence tools. The company wants to replace traditional salespeople with more technical salespeople to better sell AI tools. Microsoft has an advantage in that many large companies already use its other AI tools, but many employees want ChatGPT.

articles.title: Small Business Boom Is Quietly Benefiting These Dividend Stocks
articles.author: Brett Owens
articles.summary: The NFIB Small Business Optimism Index has increased for two straight months. Small business owners are embracing AI tools like ChatGPT Pro. Main Street Capital (MAIN) and Ares Capital (ARCC) are two of Contrarian Outlook's favorite business development companies (BDCs) to own.

articles.title: How AI Detection Is Changing What You Can Post Online
articles.author: Amber Smith
articles.summary: AI detection is the use of artificial intelligence to automatically analyze and evaluate online content according to a platform's policies and community standards. The goal is to make sure that digital spaces are safe, trustworthy, and accurate. Some challenge AI detection as they feel that it limits freedom of speech on the internet.

articles.title: This Bestselling Portable Tire Inflator Is Nearly 70% Off at Walmart, and It's a Must-Have for Summer Road Trips
articles.author: John Alexander
articles.summary: AstroAI Portable Tire Inflator is on sale at Walmart for $22. It's a 69% discount off the normal price of $70. The inflator has over 650 five-star ratings and an impressive 4.6 overall score. It can go from a flat 30 PSI to a full 36 PSI in under a minute.

articles.title: Dust hits $6M ARR helping enterprises build AI agents that actually do stuff instead of just talking
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Dust is a two-year-old artificial intelligence platform that helps enterprises build AI agents capable of completing entire business workflows. It has reached $6 million in annual revenue, a six-fold increase from $1 million just one year ago. Dust has been selected as part of Anthropic's 'Powered by Claude' ecosystem.

articles.title: PR No. 44 Ahsan Iqbal Calls for Inclusive AI Roadmaps, Sectoral Champions, and Publi (Ministry of Information and Broadcasting of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Ahsan Iqbal chaired a meeting of the National Taskforce on Artificial Intelligence. He called for a detailed and inclusive national approach to AI. He is the Minister for Planning, Development & Special Initiatives. He also is the Chairman of the Taskforce.

articles.title: Mark Cuban: The world's first trillionaire could be ‘just one dude in the basement' who's great at using AI
articles.author: Ashton Jackson
articles.summary: Mark Cuban predicts that artificial intelligence will create the world's first trillionaire. Chipotle CEO Scott Boatwright says AI tools have cut his company's hiring time by 75%. AI has potential to displace jobs, but it can also make people's lives better.

articles.title: The Rise of AI Headshots in Online Dating Profiles
articles.author: Provided Amber Smith
articles.summary: AI-generated headshots are gaining popularity in online dating profiles. Dating sites such as Instagram and TikTok have set the standard of perfection and beauty for dating. Dating apps don't yet label AI-generated images or edited images as unethical. There are some best practices to ensure ethical use of AI headshots in dating profiles to build genuine connections.

articles.title: Helpful AI prompts for your next job search
articles.author: DPA
articles.summary: AI chatbots can be used to help you find a new job and prepare for an interview. Guido Sieber, managing director at a Germany-based recruitment agency, explains how to use AI chatbots for job searching and preparing for interviews. AI should only be used as a tool in the application process.

articles.title: Decoding Google's AI Mode: A Strategic Guide for Modern Marketers & SEOs
articles.author: Sponsored Post
articles.summary: Google's search engine is evolving into an AI-powered assistant. Google's AI Mode uses generative AI to provide direct, synthesized answers from across the web without users having to click through to the website. AI Mode can reduce click-throughs, but it creates new visibility opportunities for brands.

articles.title: The Percentage of Tasks AI Agents Are Currently Failing At May Spell Trouble for the Industry
articles.summary: Venture capitalist investments in AI have skyrocketed since ChatGPT emerged in November 2022. In the last three months of 2024, over half of all venture capital in the world went to AI companies. AI agents are software products designed to complete multi-part tasks on behalf of their human taskmasters. Google's AI agent Gemini 2.5 Pro failed to complete real-world office tasks 70 percent of the time. Amazon's Nova-Pro-v1 failed 98.3 percent of its office tasks. Gartner predicts that over 40 percent of AI agent projects initiated by businesses will be cancelled by 2027.

articles.title: New ‘Mind Reading' AI Predicts What Humans Do Next
articles.author: Steve Fink via Study Finds
articles.summary: Researchers have developed an AI called Centaur that accurately predicts human behavior across virtually any psychological experiment. Centaur has been trained on data from more than 60,000 people making over 10 million decisions. It outperforms the specialized computer models scientists have been using for decades. It could revolutionize marketing, education, mental health treatment and product design.

articles.title: Ford CEO makes shocking AI unemployment claim
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: pt has been around for a few years. AI is coming to white-collar jobs soon.    for ChatGPT, but not for the present time, but for the future, as well as the future.  for the current time.  and AI.

articles.title: Google Sets Eye on Destroying Small Publishers with AI, Changes Algorithm to Wipe Out Traffic, Causes Huge Drops
articles.author: Roger Friedman
articles.summary: Showbiz411 is in its 13th year of providing breaking and exclusive entertainment news. To continue providing news that takes a fresh look at what's going on in movies, music, theater, etc., readers should donate to the website.  It is another facet of keeping fact based journalism alive.

articles.title: Meta has found another way to keep you engaged: Chatbots that message you first
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.summary: According to leaked documents, Meta is working with Alignerr to train customizable chatbots to reach out to users unprompted and follow up on any past conversations. The AI chatbots will only send follow-ups within 14 days after a user initiates a conversation and if the user has sent at least five messages to the bot within that timeframe. Character.AI is undergoing an active lawsuit after allegations that one of its bots played a role in the death of a 14-year-old boy.

articles.title: Meta has found another way to keep you engaged: Chatbots that message you first
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: According to leaked documents, Meta is working with Alignerr to train customizable chatbots to reach out to users unprompted and follow up on any past conversations. The AI chatbots will only send follow-ups within 14 days after a user initiates a conversation and if the user has sent at least five messages to the bot within that timeframe.

articles.title: This school district wants to use AI to help improve school
articles.summary: This school district wants to use AI to help improve its schools. It is using AI to improve school just now. It uses AI technology to help students learn more effectively and improve the quality of their education. It's called "Artificial Intelligence for School Improvement".

articles.title: Renting a car this summer? AI might hit you with a surprise damage claim
articles.author: Susan Ferrechio
articles.summary: SIXT Car Rental in Fort Lauderdale, Florida uses a 'Car Gate' equipped with vehicle inspection technology backed by AI to inspect rentals for damage. Hertz has also started using AI technology to scan cars. Consumers complain that the new AI detection scan is more like a scam. It attempts to force renters to pay for questionable damages.

articles.title: Fast-food restaurants are using their wealth of data to harness AI in their supply chains
articles.author: Shefali Kapadia
articles.summary: Juici Patties uses AI technology to prevent supply chain disruptions. McDonald's uses AI to maximize everything from its point-of-sale to its supply chain. Starbucks inked a deal with Microsoft to use genAI in its product development. Yum Brands, the parent company of KFC, Taco Bell, and others, partnered with Nvidia on AI.

articles.title: CoreWeave Becomes First Hyperscaler to Deploy NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 Platform
articles.author: Core Weave
articles.summary: CoreWeave is the first AI cloud provider to deploy the latest NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 systems for customers. CoreWeave plans to significantly scale deployments worldwide. Coreweave (Nasdaq: CRWV) is the AI Hyperscaler.

articles.title: X AI & Community Notes: Creation, Not Evaluation
articles.summary: X limits AI's role in Community Notes to combat misinformation. This feature allows users to collaboratively fact-check posts on the platform. Mark Zuckerberg likened his company's previous reliance on third-party fact-checking to 'too much censorship' during a conversation with Joe Rogan.

articles.title: The fight over who gets to regulate AI is far from over
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: The Republicans' One Big Beautiful Bill Act has passed the Senate and is now headed for a final vote in the House. Before its passage, senators removed a controversial amendment that would have imposed a five-year freeze on state-level regulation of AI models and apps. The bill is over 900 pages long and the Senate had just 72 hours to review it before debate and voting began.

articles.title: The Role of AI & Machine Learning in Modern Android Apps
articles.author: wax paper
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are transforming the services that Android apps provide to users. Businesses are looking for ways to enhance user experience, automate processes, and deliver personalized services using AI and ML in Android apps. The blog explains the key applications of AI in modern Android applications.

articles.title: Pinwheel Kids Smartwatch: AI Chatbot & Safety Features
articles.summary: Pinwheel Kids Smartwatch is a smartwatch with built-in AI chatbot. It's designed with children's safety in mind. It offers a combination of physical design, robust software and comprehensive parental controls. It is built to withstand the wear and tear of everyday child play.

articles.title: MBZUAI's MAILIS, AD Gaming to spotlight AI's role in future of game development
articles.author: Tahawultech
articles.summary: Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI) hosted the second session of its flagship community engagement platform, MAILIS, in Abu Dhabi. It was organized by Marcos Muller-Habig, Boris Kalmykov, Hamdan Al Ali, and Ariana Bermudez.

articles.title: As AI agents gain autonomy, trust becomes the new currency. Mastercard wants to power both.
articles.author: Matthew Driver
articles.summary: Today, AI helps us research, plan and decide. Tomorrow, it will act. The rise of agentic AI marks a shift from assistance to execution. It will be possible for AI agents to take on tasks like booking, buying, and managing on your behalf. Mastercard is taking a proactive stance in shaping the infrastructure that will support agentic commerce.

articles.title: Young children outperform state-of-the-art AI in visual object recognition
articles.author: Temple University
articles.summary: Vlad Ayzenberg, assistant professor in Temple's Psychology and Neuroscience Department, and other researchers found that preschoolers' visual object recognition is better than AI's capabilities. The study was published in Science Advances.   Ayzenburg plans to use functional MRI in awake infants to measure large-scale brain activity.

articles.title: Rigetti Computing (RGTI) Jumps 15.4% on Bullish Quantum Computing Outlook
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing, Inc. (NASDAQ:RGTI) jumped by 15.45 percent on Wednesday to close at $13.08 apiece. Cantor Fitzgerald gave an 'overweight' rating and a $15 price target on its first coverage of Rigetti Computing's stock. The investment firm said the quantum computing sector poses a huge growth potential despite it being in the early stages.

articles.title: BigBear AI (BBAI) Takes Part in Huge International Military Exercise, Soars 13.7%
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: BigBear.ai Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:BBAI) is taking part in a huge international military exercise called Project Convergence – Capstone 5 (PC-C5), which aims to test Next Generation Command Control (NGC2) systems using relevant AI models. BigBear AI's VANE platform proved critical in helping forces gain situational awareness and identify emerging threats.

articles.title: How AI could help male infertility
articles.author: Matthew Abshire
articles.summary: A drive-by shooting in Chicago killed four people and injured 14 others. Bryan Kohberger admits to Idaho student murders. Beyoncé's 'flying' car prop at a Cowboy Carter concert in Houston fell on its own during a technical fault. Heatwaves have pushed temperatures above 104 degrees Fahrenheit in Europe.

articles.title: IonQ (IONQ) Bullish Rating Propels Stock by 11.6%
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: IonQ, Inc. (NYSE:IONQ) saw its share prices jump by 11.6 percent on Wednesday to end at $44.75 apiece after Cantor Fitzgerald raised its rating and price target for the company. The investment firm gave IonQ an 'overweight' rating and a price target of $45 on the belief that the quantum computing industry remains to be one of the most highly coveted technical milestones with huge economical implications.

articles.title: Former CGI Exec Jason Balser Joins RELI Group
articles.summary: Jason Balser has been appointed as senior director of AI and data strategy at RELI Group. He has over 20 years of industry experience in supporting digital transformation initiatives. Before joining RELI, he spent 19 years at CGI as vice president of consulting services and digital transformation and director of product development.

articles.title: A Leading Indicator Has Emerged Suggesting That the AI Industry Is Cooked
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is spending billions of dollars to build supercharged AI. Mark Zuckerberg spent $45 billion on the world's most expensive fool's errand: virtual reality. Zuckerberg is launching a "superintelligence" lab and picking off OpenAI talent like flies. He's also paying people up to $100 million a head as a signing bonus.

articles.title: Tech users are falling in love with their chatbot assistants
articles.author: Emma Ayers
articles.summary: Chatbot users are spending hours a day in private conversations with AI systems, building connections that can feel comforting and intimate. 25% of adults under 40 said AI partners could replace human partners, 7% of single young adults said they were open to an AI romantic relationship, and 1% said they already have one.

articles.title: YC Startup Pitch Deck: See How They Raised $2.4 Million
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Cekura secured a $2.4 million seed round led by Y Combinator. Cekura's platform simulates conversations and generates thousands of challenging scenarios for AI agents. It's important to stress test AI agents before they go live to ensure their reliability.

articles.title: Former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati's startup offers up to $500,000 in salaries
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Thinking Machines Lab (TML), the AI startup founded by Mira Murati, is paying top technical talent up to half a million dollars in salary. TML paid three technical staffers $450,000 each, while a fourth received $500,000 in compensation. The company recently raised $2 billion in funding, valuing it at $10 billion.

articles.title: Managers are using AI to determine raises, promotions, layoffs
articles.author: Andrew Dorn
articles.summary: 6 in 10 U.S. managers use AI tools to make decisions about their direct reports. ChatGPT is the most popular AI-using tool among managers, with 53% citing it as their go-to. Nearly 30% use Microsoft's Copilot and 16% use Google's Gemini. California state senator introduced the 'No Robo Bosses Act' in March.

articles.title: PagerDuty's Eric Forseter on AI, Automation
articles.summary: Eric Forseter, vice president of public sector at PagerDuty, wrote a commentary on Federal News Network. He said the use of artificial intelligence and automation could help agencies improve digital services amid budget constraints, increasing cybersecurity risks and workforce shortages. He called on agencies to develop AI governance frameworks, transparency measures and ethical guidelines to ensure the responsible deployment of AI tools.

articles.title: BofA Reiterates Buy Rating on Adobe Stock, Keeps PT at $475
articles.author: Ali Hassan

articles.title: Understanding LLM AI: Be Very Careful
articles.author: Mike Zimmer
articles.summary: Large language models (LLMs) produce text by identifying and replicating statistical patterns across massive datasets. This method enables remarkable fluency, stylistic mimicry, and breadth of recall. However, it also introduces a fundamental distortion: LLMs do not know what they are saying. They cannot judge the truth, significance, or contextual relevance of their outputs. Their generative outputs are constructed on the fly based on likelihood, not documentation.
